title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014 authorizes the use of specific programs to provide support for entrepreneurs, including entrepreneurial education, business incubation, and growth acceleration services. This section does not apply to services for small businesses owned by an Indian. The Administrator shall annually report to the Committees on Small Business on all entrepreneurial development activities undertaken in the current fiscal year, excluding services for small businesses owned by an Indian tribe. The Administrator must report annually to the Committees on Small Business about entrepreneurial development activities in the current fiscal year, detailing program descriptions, operating procedures, grant award processes, and lists of awardees, contractors, and vendors. The Administrator must report annually to the Committees on Small Business about entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, grant award processes, lists of awardees, contractors, vendors, funding obligations, and responsible individuals for each program and activity. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services without prohibition.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. Section 21(a)(3)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include governing data collection activities for grant applicants. Additionally, a new provision for an Annual Report on Data Collection is added to Section 21 of the Act. The Small Business Act is amended to include data collection activities for grant applicants and a provision for an Annual Report on Data Collection is added to the Act. The Administrator will report annually to the Committees on Small Business regarding data collection activities related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS.

Section 21(a)(3)(C) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow Small Business Development Centers to collect fees from private partnerships and cosponsorships.

SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS.

Section 21(a)(4)(C)(v)(I) of the Small Business Act is amended to remove certain items.

SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. The Administrator shall not award grants under this section to entities that did not receive grants prior to September 30, 2014, and seek to renew them after that date. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses and authorize disaster recovery assistance through small business development centers. The Administrator may authorize a small business development center to assist a small business outside the state during a declared disaster. A small business development center can provide assistance to a small business located in an area declared a major disaster by the President. The center should strive to maintain services in any affected state. The small business development center should ensure continuity of services in disaster-affected states to provide counselors and access to recovery facilities. The Administrator shall allow small business development center personnel to use designated facilities for disaster recovery assistance. SEC. 10. INCLUSION OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING FOR UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS: Amends the Small Business Act to educate unemployed individuals on entrepreneurship and assist them in starting new businesses.
